    • Method Detail

      • withLocalValidation

        public OAuthBearerRequestAuthenticator withLocalValidation()
        Description copied from interface: OAuthBearerRequestAuthenticator
        Flags the authenticator to carry out a local validation rather than a validation against Stormpath's backend.

        Doing a local validation will for sure be faster since there is no network traffic involved. However, using Stormpath to validate the token through the REST API ensures that the token can actually be validated against the state of your application and account. To illustrate the difference:

        Validation CriteriaLocallyStormpath
        Token hasn’t been tampered withyesyes
        Token hasn’t expiredyesyes
        Token hasn’t been revokednoyes
        Account hasn’t been disabled, and hasn’t been deletednoyes
        Issuer is Stormpathyesyes
        Issuing application is still enabled, and hasn’t been deletednoyes
        Account is still in an account store for the issuing applicationnoyes
        Specified by:
        withLocalValidation in interface OAuthBearerRequestAuthenticator
        Returns:
        This instance for method chaining.

      • authenticate

        public OAuthBearerRequestAuthenticationResult authenticate(OAuthRequestAuthentication authenticationRequest)
        Description copied from interface: OAuthRequestAuthenticator
        An attempt to perform any kind of OAuth2 Authentication: Password Grant, Refresh Grant and JWT.
        Specified by:
        authenticate in interface OAuthRequestAuthenticator<OAuthBearerRequestAuthenticationResult>
        Parameters:
        authenticationRequest - the OAuthRequestAuthentication that this authenticator will attempt.
        Returns:
        a sub-class of OAuthRequestAuthenticationResult providing all the properties associated with a successful authentication.
